conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true 3D cutaway: extruded walls with thickness, visible top/side faces, angled perspective, and ceiling/roof removed to expose interior volumes.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear wall height/thickness and readable volumes; isometric-like view; cutaway is mostly clean though exterior massing/cut edges around terraces/decks appear simplified versus the plan.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall room count and core adjacency (living/dining central, kitchen below, bedrooms around perimeter, multiple toilets, utility) largely match, but terrace/deck configuration differs and some room sizing/placement appears altered (notably utility and exterior openings). Bedroom labels also appear swapped relative to the 2D plan.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture is present (beds, sofa, dining), kitchen counters/appliances shown, and bathroom fixtures included; some rooms are minimally furnished and a few placements feel generic rather than plan-specific.

visual_clarity.notes: Geometry is clear with good lighting and distinguishable walls/floors; however, multiple text labels are overlaid in the 3D view and some glazing/openings are visually emphasized in ways that reduce strict plan-readability.

detected_errors.description: Deck/terrace geometry does not faithfully match the 2D plan (top decks appear simplified/partially missing or reshaped in the 3D model).
Some proportional differences are evident (e.g., utility area appears larger/reshaped compared with the 2D plan).
Openings/windows are not fully verifiable against the plan and appear stylized (large glazing emphasized on one facade), suggesting potential mismatch in window placement/extent.
Text labels are present in the 3D render, reducing presentation cleanliness.

summary: A true, clean 3D cutaway is produced with strong volumetric readability, but several layout-fidelity issues (notably decks/terraces and some proportions/openings) prevent an excellent geometric match.
